titleStmt.title: William G. English to James W. Tate
CWG2633

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: Yr favor of 28' Nov rec'd, and in reply would state that I fwd oath of office, and fee for new Commission on receipt of same, and now hand your new oath of office with impression of seal & should not find that the charge of new Commission has been rec'd at your office I will again remit as I did before in 10Â¢ U.S. postage Stamps providing I cannot obtain a U.S. Treasury note for that amt which are very scarce in this distant land.

Very Respy your obt svt
Wm. G. English

Hon
Jas. W. Tate
asst Secy of State
Frankft

figure.ab:
WILLIAM G ENGLISH
COMMISSIONER
FOR
"Kentucky"
SACRAMENTO CAL
